title: What are 3 subjects I should learn more about in life? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are plenty, so I cannot say 3 alone, but these are things everybody should know at least at on a basic understanding of them, as they are productive for everyday life:1. Philosophy2. Science3. Economics4. Business5. Investments6. Mathematics7. Research8. Survival skills, such as self-defense, surviving if something major happens, etc. 9.  Sales10. Communication skills: Vocally, Body Language, Written, and Electronically11. Psychology about others, and themselves12. Computers13. Software14. Current and Future Trends15. The necessary skills to make a good income16. How to study something as fast as possible, and to learn as fast as possible, to reduce time in learning something. This will help you to learn more stuff.17. How to hold a good conversation with others, such as humor, excitement, etc.. This can be for any form of communication. 18. How to present yourself well to others19. Daily skills to survive, such as fixing your car, repairing your house, remodeling, etc.20. Nutrition, the proper diet, and other things necessary to fuel your body properly.21. Social Interaction with friends, boyfriend/girlfriend, spouse, family, etc.22. How to stand up for yourself, and not let others take advantage of you. 23. The anthropology of humans, such as religion, culture, history, etc.24. Culinary arts25. Management skills, in time, money, resources, etc.26. The Law27. Exercise and working out28. Learning other languages that are not native to you.29. Political Science30. How to meditation properly31. How to improve themselves as much as possible.  There are more, but these are a good start.

Health and Nutrition: A healthy body is essential to achieving whatever goals you have set for yourself in life. Understanding nutrition and the ways in which one can keep oneself fit, in function and in form, goes a long way in life.  Personal Finance: Managing your finances well earns a sense of security that could be a precursor to functioning well in other areas of your life. Psychology: It helps you connect with other people in a better way and also to understand your own actions and choices effectively. It helps you in making personal as well as financial decisions.   These subjects could also be seen from the perspective of Maslow's hierarchy of needs.    When you learn about nutrition, hygiene, and exercise, you are able to better satisfy your physiological needs and ensure safety of body and health. Knowing about personal finance helps achieve security of employment, resources, family (financial requirements of a family unit) and property. Studying psychology helps connect with people in a better fashion. This aids to creating an environment of love and belonging and to build up self esteem and confidence.
